Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water, depicting them clearly with distinct environmental features.
The student can include at least three different types of living things in each habitat, showing a variety of animals and plants appropriate to each environment.
The student can label each living thing in their drawing, providing clear labels for all features and organisms.
The student can effectively show and label patterns that make each habitat unique, accurately representing specific types of plants and animals found in each habitat.
The student can compare the living things in each habitat by accurately showing and labeling both similar and different plants and animals.
The student can organize the drawing clearly to highlight the diversity of plant and animal life in each habitat, using layout and labels to effectively communicate the biological diversity.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally overlook labeling a minor feature or organism due to oversight, though this is rare at this level (e.g., forgetting to label a smaller plant).
The student might not show minor detail variations between individual plants or animals that are not the main focus of the task, focusing instead on the broader diversity.
